author: philngo
content: Hey <@!420951281910284289> <@!552133098075193354> , I have <@!416370369675395072> from web3.js here working on type safety for our web3.js typescript rewrite. We're having some trouble figuring out the ultimate source of truth for the JSON-RPC specifications as there seems to be some methods missing between https://eth.wiki/json-rpc/API and link to spec on https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis. Example being `getUncleBy` methods which has been addressed by <@!543900561460822016> here: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/issues/30. Any guidance on what we should be using?

author: lightclient
content: The ultimate source of truth is what clients are doing today. The `execution-apis` repo is attempting to take on that burden, but there are still likely still a handful of bugs in the spec and missing methods. Everything is being tracked in the issues

author: nazarhussain
content: Hey, Nazar from web3 team. If we want to refer to a documented version of the Eth JSON-RPC specs, do you think Eth Wiki as mentioned above is the right reference? As going into implementation details of any client could be less productive and not good for us for future reference in in our docs.

author: lightclient
content: no you should refer to the `execution-apis` repository, the wiki is no longer maintained

author: nazarhussain
content:
We identified that some RPC methods e.g. `eth_getStorageAt` ,`eth_getUncleByBlockHashAndIndex` and few others are not in the `execution-apis` repository but are there in the Wiki. On the reverse case `eth_feeHistory` is not in the Wiki but in the `execution-apis`. 

So if we follow this pattern. 

1. Use all the methods defined in the `execution-apis` repo 
2. Use additional methods defined in the Eth Wiki 

Will that cover the Eth JSON-RPC API completely? I want to limit our implementation point to a referable source.

author: nazarhussain
content: FYI Here the pull request, if you guys want to add your feedback. https://github.com/ChainSafe/web3.js/pull/4513

author: timbeiko
content: The two methods you list from the wiki do seem to be supported by clients. I wonder why they aren't in execution-specs? Just missed them? Too complex to define in the spec?

author: timbeiko
content: It might be valuable to open a PR against execution-specs with the missing spec methods with a "TODO" definition so at least the list is comprehensive?

author: lightclient
content: The missing uncle methods is documented in the issues, i'll open another issue for the `eth_getStorageAt`

author: lightclient
content: I will get to filling these in eventually, but if anyone wants to take a stab i am more than happy to review and merge ðŸ™‚

author: nazarhussain
content: Thanks guys for the input. We will proceed further with keeping `execution-apis`  as main focus for all methods. And what ever we found missing will create the issues and hopefully PRs for those.
